commander.name: Unknown
commander.notes: Brig Gen Scataglia commanded division later (captured at El Alamein 1942). Commander for 1941-Q2 not identified in sources.

total_personnel.notes: Semi-motorized infantry division, standard Italian establishment 1941. Personnel estimate based on standard Italian infantry division structure.

ground_vehicles_total.notes: Semi-motorized division with partial truck transport capability

tanks.notes: Standard infantry division, no organic tank battalion

mortars.notes: Mortar units not explicitly documented in available sources for Pavia Division 1941

aircraft_total.notes: No organic air assets at division level

supply_logistics.logistics_notes: Semi-motorized division with limited fuel reserves. North Africa operations constrained by Axis supply difficulties across Mediterranean. Partial motorization allows some operational mobility but dependent on supply columns.

terrain_effects.mobility_impact: Good mobility in open desert, siege operations around fortified positions

seasonal_factors.dust_impact: Significant - vehicle and weapon maintenance challenges
seasonal_factors.notes: Spring conditions favorable but transitioning to summer heat. Siege of Tobruk requires sustained operations in static positions.

subordinate_units.notes: Three infantry battalions plus regimental support companies
Three infantry battalions plus regimental support companies
Mixed engineer battalion for field fortifications and mine warfare
Provides motorized transport for semi-motorized capability
Raggruppamento Centri e Reparti - Supply and logistics section

operational_history.notes: Division was in Tripolitania before Italy entered war. Advanced into Egypt with Graziani (September 1940) but played limited role. Artillery regiment sent forward and lost in 1940-41 campaign. In 1941-Q2, division participated in siege of Tobruk under XXI Corps. Division was eventually destroyed at El Alamein in 1942.

subordinate_unit_aggregation.notes: Difference accounts for division HQ, signals, and minor support elements not detailed in subordinate units

primary_sources: US HQ G2 Order of Battle Italian Army July 1943
Contemporary German and British intelligence reports
gaps: Division commander for 1941-Q2 not identified (Scataglia commanded later)
Precise equipment counts for some support units unavailable
Mortar battalion details not confirmed in sources
data_quality.validation_notes: Data confidence high for regimental structure and commanders. Personnel and equipment estimates based on standard Italian semi-motorized division TO&E circa 1941. Operational context well-documented (siege of Tobruk, XXI Corps).

metadata.extraction_method: Historical document analysis with cross-source validation
metadata.notes: Semi-motorized infantry division serving in North Africa 1941. Structure based on Nafziger detailed TO&E (17th Pavia Division page 5 of PDF). Commander for 1941-Q2 period not identified in sources; Scataglia commanded division at El Alamein 1942 when division was destroyed.
